Menus - The British Open Pub - The British Open Pub click here to ORDER NOW Menus Events About Us Gift Cards Contact Order Now Order Catering Menus Events About Us Gift Cards Contact Order Now Order Catering  UPDATED MENU COMING SOON! Please feel free to navigate through our Menus. HAPPY HOUR 11-6pm Everyday! Excludes holidays $2 OFF ALL HOUSE WINES $2 OFF SINGLE LIQUOR WELL DRINKS excludes margaritas, martinis, etc $1 OFF NON-ROTATING BEERS TEE-OFF Shrimp Stack A light and fresh stack of chilled shrimp, avocado, and mango salsa drizzled with remoulade aioli Sausage Rolls English sausage wrapped in flaky pastry Rings & Shrooms Beer battered onion rings and button mushrooms Poutine Our English chips topped with fried cheese curds and smothered in brown gravy Big Bavarian Pretzel A plate sized pretzel accompanied by beer cheese for dipping Scotch Eggs *pub favorite Hard boiled eggs wrapped in English sausage and breaded Pub Flat Breads *pub favorite Bacon & Avocado Flatbread drizzled in balsamic glaze Buffalo Chicken Flatbread with homemade ranch dressing Brie and Green Apple Flatbread with Melba drizzle and almonds Gaelic Rolls *pub favorite Tender homecooked corned beef blended with fresh cabbage and swiss cheese, tucked into a pub sized egg roll and served with creamy mustard sauce Crispers Home-made potato chips served with ranch for dipping Pub Nachos Our crispers smothered with melted cheese, tomatoes, scallions, and jalapeno ranch sauce *Top ‘em with chicken, chili, or sriracha bourbon pork Chicken Tenders Hand breaded juicy chicken tenderloins with ranch for dipping Chicken Wings Your choice of: Mild • Medium • Hot • Hot Honey Garlic • Jameson BBQ Sauce Served with celery and ranch or blue cheese (6) • (12) • (18) BRITISH FAVORITES Squire John’s Fish & Chips *pub favorite The pride and joy of the British Open! A generous portion of North Atlantic cod fried in a light beer batter, baked or blackened — Available in Regular Portion or Light Portion Liver & Onions Tender beef liver, sautéed with onions, topped with bacon, accompanied with smashed potatoes and covered with a light brown gravy — Available in Regular Portion or Light Portion Proper British Cod Cakes Tender North Atlantic Cod poached and blended with Yukon Gold Mashed potatoes, seasoning and spices and panko bread crumbs and then pan fried Bangers & Mash English style pork sausages served with sautéed onions, smashed potatoes & brown gravy — Available in Regular Portion or Light Portion Pub Steak Black Gold Espresso rubbed certified angus beef teres major seared and served with a bourbon butter sauce, accompanied by mashed potatoes Corned Beef & Cabbage *pub favorite Hand sliced home-cooked corned beef accompanied by sautéed shredded cabbage and smashed potato FROM OUR KETTLES Monday Cream of Mushroom Tuesday Tomato Bisque Wednesday Split Pea with Ham Thursday Chicken & Rice Friday Clam Chowder Weekends Chef ’s Choice Everyday Beef & Bean Chili French Onion PUB PIES, PASTIES & WELLINGTONS Cottage Pie Or as Grandma called it – Shepherd’s Pie. Ground beef, peas, carrots & onions topped with smashed potatoes and melted cheese Regular Portion Light Portion Chicken & Mushroom Pie An old favorite . . . tender pieces of chicken breast and mushrooms cooked in cream sauce, topped off with flaky pastry Veggie Pie Edamame, broccoli, corn, red peppers, carrots & mushrooms cooked in cream sauce topped off with flaky pastry Steak & Ale Pie Tender chunks of slow cooked prime rib, button mushrooms and a brown ale gravy topped off with flaky pastry Cornish Pastie *pub favorite Ground beef, onions, potatoes, peas and carrots wrapped in flaky pastry Chicken & Broccoli Pastie Chicken, broccoli and cheese wrapped in flaky pastry Prime Rib Pastie Shaved prime rib with cheese wrapped in flaky pastry Meatloaf Wellington *pub favorite Our homemade meatloaf, wrapped in puff pastry, sliced, grilled, topped with mushrooms and brown gravy, accompanied by smashed potatoes FAIRWAY SPECIALS Yankee Pot Roast Tender, mouth-watering roast beef with smashed potatoes and served with jardinière sauce Prime Rib of Beef *pub favorite A hearty-sized cut served with smashed potatoes and au jus Add (5) Shrimp | Add Crab Cake Creamy Garlic Salmon Sautéed Salmon filet over Yukon mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach finished with creamy lemon-garlic sauce. Chicken & Chips Hand breaded juicy chicken tenderloins with chips and your choice of chicken gravy or ranch for dipping Fettuccine Alfredo Our mascot’s favorite — Large shrimp sautéed with spinach, tomatoes, peas, onions and roasted red peppers, finished with a creamy garlic sauce over fettuccine Shrimp & Chips *pub favorite Hand breaded, grilled or blackened shrimp & English chips Almond Crusted Baked Scrod Tender scrod lightly coated with almonds and panko breadcrumbs, topped with a creamy garlic sauce and served with mashed potatoes HANDHELDS Served with choice of English Chips, Crispers or Coleslaw. Subs may be an additional cost. Pretzel Bun or Gluten Free Burger Bun Chicken Club Grilled chicken topped with avocado, bacon, pickled red onions, HP aioli, lettuce and tomato on grilled sourdough bread Corned Beef Reuben Hand cut corned beef brisket, sauerkraut, thousand island dressing and swiss cheese on grilled marble rye bread Barron’s Prime Rib Bomber *pub favorite Shaved prime rib, onions and mushrooms with your choice of cheese on a toasted hoagie roll with au jus Sriracha Bourbon Pork Sandwich Pulled pork piled high tossed in sriracha bourbon sauce and topped with a scoop of coleslaw Fish Sandwich Fried, baked or blackened cod served with lettuce and tomato, on a hoagie roll Bacon Brie LT *pub favorite Our twist on the BLT adds melted brie cheese and mayo to the usual suspects on a crispy baguette Pub Style Chicken Salad Homemade chicken salad atop lettuce, tomato and a toasted pretzel bun. Or make it traditional on white, wheat or marble rye! Ranch House Chicken Sandwich Fried chicken topped with bacon and sliced brie on a pretzel bun, drizzled with ranch dressing Vegetarian Reuben (vegetarian) Marinated and sliced portobello mushroom, sauerkraut, and Swiss cheese on grilled rye bread with 1000 island dressing Bourbon Bacon Burger What a mouthful!!!! Bourbon glazed premium blended burger topped with bacon, Havarti cheese, onion straws and HP aioli on top of a grilled Pretzel Bun BOP Patty Melt Our specially blended burger on rye bread with sautéed onions, Swiss cheese and HP aioli Build Your Own Burger An exceptional blend of ground chuck, brisket and short rib served on a brioche bun Load It Your Way American cheese, cheddar, swiss, provolone, sautéed onions, sautéed mushrooms Smoked cheddar, smoked gouda, brie sauce, blue cheese, bacon, fried egg, portabello ON THE GREEN Dressings: Ranch, Bleu Cheese, Honey Mustard, Oil & Vinegar, Thousand Island, Balsamic Vinaigrette, Raspberry Vinaigrette Ceasar Salad Our secret recipe with shaved parmesan and croutons English Cobb Salad *pub favorite Mixed garden lettuce topped with bacon, egg, tomato, peas, bleu cheese crumbles and scallions Sand Wedge Iceberg wedge with crispy Jameson glazed bacon, smoked gouda, tomatoes, ranch and a drizzle of balsamic glaze Seasonal Salad Ask your Server about our Specialty Seasonal Selection. Top any salad with… Chicken Salad Shrimp or Marinated Portabella Chicken Breast Cod Salmon SAND TRAP SIDES English Chips (American steak fries) Homemade Mashed Potatoes Coleslaw Crispers (homemade potato chips) Peas Carrots Broccoli Vegetable Medley Garlic Red Potatoes Pub Beans (green beans sautéed with mushrooms, onion, & garlic) Onion Rings Side Salad Ceasar Salad Homemade Mac & Cheese Side of Beef or Chicken Gravy JUNIOR GOLFERS Age 10 years and under, Please! Mac & Cheese • Chicken Fingers & Chips • Grilled Cheese & Chips Burger & Chips • Fish & Chips Kid’s Ice Cream Sundae (1 scoop) AFTER DINNER DRINKS British Open Pub Irish Coffee Irish Cream & Irish Whiskey Nutty Irishman Coffee Irish Cream & Hazelnut Liquor Kilted Cup Coffee Irish Cream & Drambuie Spiced Honey Whiskey Peppermint Paddy Coffee Irish Cream & Peppermint Schnapps Butter Cream Coffee Irish Cream & Butterscotch Schnapps Fancy a pot of English Tea? We serve P.G. Tips DESSERTS Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream Bread Pudding *pub favorite A classic recipe served warm with cream Apple Cobbler Deep dish with sweet cinnamon apples drizzled with caramel sauce Cinnamon Caramel Crunch *pub favorite Vanilla bean ice cream in flaky puff pastry, sprinkled with cinnamon and sugar, and topped with caramel and whipped cream Chocolate Cake Moist layers of chocolate cake and fudge served hot or cold Key Lime Pie Rich, authentic key lime pie Peanut Butter Pie Creamy peanut butter pie topped with Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups Ask about our Dessert of the Day! LUNCH SPECIALS ’til 4 pm Soup & Salad Soup of the day and House or Caesar Salad Substitute French Onion • Chowder • Chili BRUNCH MENU served Sundays from 11am – 2pm Full English Breakfast Two eggs, rashers, english banger, black pudding, white pudding, baked beans, grilled tomatoes, and mushrooms. Served with toast. The American Two eggs cooked your way, bacon, hash browns, toast, and melba sauce. Corned Beef Hash Homemade hash of fresh cooked corned beef and red potatoes. Served with 2 eggs and toast. Jameson Avocado Toast A homemade avocado spread on our marble rye bread. Topped with two eggs, diced tomato, red onion and sprinkled with our own Jameson glazed bacon. Irish Benedict This sliced irish bacon on an english muffin, topped with poached eggs, and homemade hollandaise sauce. Served with hash browns. Bloody Mary Queen of Scotts Our classic favorite – as bold as the women it’s named after. Spice it up with Absolut Peppar Mary & The Boys Add a “Gulf” touch to your Mary. Our Mary surrounded by her boys – 6 large beer boiled gulf shrimp served chilled. Don’t like Bloody’s (Like Kelly), Substitute with a glass of Jameson and keep the boys Bottomless Mimosa or Peach Bellini La Marca Prosecco Mimosa La Marca Prosecco Peach Bellini Guinness Nitro Cold Brew In a Can Order Here Hours Sun-Wed: 11AM to 10PM Thurs: 11AM to 11PM Fri & Sat: 11AM to 12AM Brunch Sun: 11AM to 2PM Happy Hour Daily: 11AM to 6PM. Location 367 Jacaranda Boulevard Venice, FL 34292 Contact us 941.492.9227 catering@britishopenpub.com Follow Follow Join Our Rewards Program Sign up for savings and rewards! Who is in charge at the UK's biggest pub companies default-output-block.skip-main The Inspiration for Pub Success Since 1794 Register Search menu home menu home Latest Food & Drink Legal Operations Companies Resources Events Close menu Queryly search Home Latest Show Latest sub sections News Trends & Analysis Opinion & Interviews Investments New Product Development Events Podcasts Promotional Features Food & Drink Show Food & Drink sub sections Beer Cask Cider Low & No Alcohol Soft & Hot Drinks Spirits & Cocktails Wine Food Trends Ingredients Menu Ideas Snacks Legal Show Legal sub sections Health & Safety Legislation Licensing Law Property Law Operations Show Operations sub sections Design & Furnishings Entertainment & Events Environmental, Social & Governance Equipment Financial Marketing Staffing Technology Companies Show Companies sub sections Admiral Taverns Greene King Marston's Punch Pubs & Co Star Pubs & Bars Stonegate Group Independent Operators Managed Groups Gastropubs Resources Show Resources sub sections Ale & Stout Bar & Catering Equipment Cellar, Dispense & Bar Equipment Cider Design & Refurbishment Entertainment Food Lager Legal Marketing Outdoor Professional Services RTDs Security Smoking & Alternatives Soft drinks Spirits Technology Training Wine Work wear Suppliers Events Show Events sub sections Shows & Conferences Editorial Webinars Awards Meet those in charge of the UK's biggest pub companies By Rebecca Weller 23-Feb-2024 Last updated on 27-Sep-2024 at 08:07 GMT Into the boardroom: Who is in charge at the UK's biggest pub companies? (Credit:Getty/Klaus Vedfelt) The Morning Advertiser has taken a look behind the scenes and into the boardrooms of the UK’s six biggest pub companies. Made up of Stonegate, Greene King, Marston’s, Star Pubs & Bars, Punch and Admiral Taverns, we get to know each of the businesses leaders and learn about their history. Stonegate: David McDowall Britain’s biggest pubco is managed by chief executive office David McDowall, who succeeded Simon Longbottom in November 2022. McDowall brought a wealth of experience with him when he joined Stonegate, which has 4,500 pubs, having previously worked as president and chief operating officer at BrewDog. The CEO, who has 15 years of board level experience in the sector and is also a board member of trade body UKHospitality, had been with BrewDog since 2015, when he was  appointed managing director of its bars. McDowall also held the position of non-executive chair for competitive socialising brand NQ64 from December 2020 to January this year and worked as group operations director for the G1 Group for more than six years, from December 2008 to December 2014. Last summer, McDowall spoke to The Morning Advertiser’s Editor Ed Bedington about his excitement for his new role with Stonegate and detailed his future plans for the business, including a focus on digital innovation and opportunities to expand the firm further. Read more here . Greene King: Nick Mackenzie Nick Mackenzie has been CEO of Greene King, which has more than 2,700 sites, since 2019. His predecessor, Rooney Anand, had previously held the position for 14 years. Prior to joining Greene King, Mackenzie was boss of leisure company Merlin Entertainments with more than 20 years’ experience in a variety of roles within the industry. Mackenzie is also a qualified charted surveyor and started his career working with Bass and then with Allied Domecq as its acquisitions direction before joining Burger King as its development director. He joined The Tussauds Group in 2002, which was subsequently acquired by Merlin in 2007, where he remained to head up its property and development group. In 2011, Mackenzie became managing director at Resort Theme Parks before moving across to lead the Midway business in 2015. He also previously held the role of independent non-executive director for pub group Thwaites – which he relinquished before joining Greene King. In December last year, Mackenzie was also elected as chairman of the British Beer & Pub Association (BBPA) replacing St Austell Brewery chief executive Kevin George. Star Pubs & Bars: Lawson Mountstevens Lawson Mountstevens has been managing director of Star Pubs & Bars, which is part of Heineken UK and has a portfolio of around 2,400 pubs, since 2016. Though the pubco boss has worked with Heineken UK for more than two decades, having first joined the global brewer as a regional sales director in January 2000 and progressing to a national sales director position in 2007. In 2011, Mountstevens, who also has a degree in economic from the University of Manchester, was appointed as Heineken UK’s on trade managing director before the moving on to take the reigns at Star Pubs & Bars. Prior to this, from 1992 to 2000, he worked at Scottish & Newcastle, which was acquired by Heineken in 2008 and subsequently became Star Pubs & Bars in 2012. Marston’s: Justin Platt The most recent appointment in our round up, Justin Platt has been at the helm of Marston’s since January this year. His appointment was announced in November 2023, after his predecessor Andrew Andrea agreed with the pubco’s board he would step down from the chief executive office role with immediate effect. Platt was appointed following an external process and brought more than 30 years’ experience with him to Marston’s. He had spent the previous 12 years at Merlin Entertainments, most recently as chief strategy officer and, prior to that, in a variety of operational leadership roles. Platt also has a degree in economics from the University of Leeds. Punch Pubs: Andy Spencer Andy Spencer was appointed as chief executive officer of Punch Pubs in September 2024, taking over the position from Clive Chesser . Spencer first joined Punch as managing director in February 2019 and worked his way up to chief operating officer before being taking on the role of CEO. Prior to this, Spencer had worked at Brewhouse & Kitchen as group operations director and for Metropolitan Pub Company as operations director before that. The CEO, who has a Bachelor of Science degree in hotel and catering management from the University of Surrey, also worked for Greene King from 2001 to 2012, rising up the ranks from senior sales development manager to business development director. Admiral Taverns: Chris Jowsey Closing our round-up we have Admiral Taverns boss Chris Jowsey, who has been heading things up at the pubco since 2019. Jowsey, who has more than 20 years’ experience in the sector, took over the role as Admiral chief executive officer from Kevin Georgel and had previously worked as Heineken UK’s on-trade director since 2016. Prior to this, the CEO had taken on various roles with Heineken, having joined the company in 2009, and previously worked as a regional managing director for Newcastle Breweries followed by a similar role at John Smiths. Jowsey also has a Batchelors degree and MBA in philosophy, politics and economics from University College, Oxford. Demand for American sports in pubs 'growing exponentially' 23-Feb-2024 By Rebecca Weller Showing American sports offers “massive benefits” for operators as demand grows “exponentially”, but passion is key to tap into the trend, Hickory’s managing director John Welsh told The Morning Advertiser (MA). Our members brew over 90% of British beer and own over 20,000 pubs. We are a passionate, experienced team, delivering tangible change and benefits for our members to ensure a thriving pub and brewing sector in the UK. We are the voice of pubs and brewers. "We're here to speak up for our members, to make sure pubs and brewers running brilliant businesses in every single part of the UK are heard. "Our pubs and breweries are a cornerstone of British heritage and we're here to make sure they're a part of our country's future." Skip to content Book Now Home About Us Food & Wine + Food & Wine Christmas 2024 Private Dining & Parties What’s On Bookings Contact Us Careers Book Now Home About Us Food & Wine + Food & Wine Christmas 2024 Private Dining & Parties What’s On Bookings Contact Us Careers Book Now FOLLOW US: About Us About Us Our Story We’re a team of passionate individuals who’ve taken our wealth of experience in the hospitality industry to launch our flagship pub, The York Norwich. Inspired by the places, food and wine we enjoy, we’ve created a space that is welcoming to everyone, a place where friends, families and individuals can meet, relax and unwind while enjoying great food and drink. A Brief History Dating back to 1878, The York has a legacy of being a mainstay in the community serving as a popular, well-loved pub in the Golden Triangle. We aim to honour this heritage by bringing back some of that Victorian charm such as the Pétanque pitch in the pub garden – a nod to The York bowling club who were based at The York in the early 1920’s whilst introducing some of our own personal touches such as an ever-changing, seasonal menu reflecting our love of modern British food. BOOK NOW Our Ethos Upon reviving life back into The York we’re focused on seasonality, locality and affordability. With an abundance of quality farms, bakeries and seafood purveyors in the Norfolk area it is our aim to showcase these ingredients and produce alongside an enticing drinks offering from exciting brewers and distilleries. A Place to Relax Step into The York and instantly feel a sense of warmth and comfort. If it’s cold outside you’ll be sure to find an open fire flickering away, sink into our sumptuous ox blood Chesterfields and comfortable seating and let the afternoon turn into evening. If the sun is shining head on out to the beer garden for a game of boules or sit amongst the herb gardens, either way you’ll be able to enjoy lunch, dinner or bar snacks served throughout the day. Explore our menu and wine list below. OUR MENU Our Suppliers We take great pride in supporting local suppliers and creating strong relationships within the community. We collaborate with some of the best producers in the region food producers for our ever-changing menu, our drinks menu with locally brewed cask ales, beers and gin right through to local florists for our private dining events and parties. Fresh, Local, Sustainable. With Norfolk’s culinary heritage we’re working with some of the best ingredients and drinks suppliers around. Our meat and hand reared beef is from Swannington Farm, seafood & game from Howard & Son , fruit and vegetables from Barsby Produce and fresh, artisan breads from the bakers at Dozen Bakery feature throughout our modern British menu. With a strong focus on seasonality and use of fresh local produce, our menu reflects the rich offering Norfolk and the surrounding areas have to offer. Our drinks list features drinks from local suppliers such as; Lacons Brewery , Wildcraft Brewery and Aspall Cyder of Suffolk and other locally brewed cask ales alongside gin from Bullards . We also serve a number of popular European beers alongside our low-intervention wine list – explore our wine list below VIEW WINE LIST Subscribe Now Thank You Thank you, your sign up request was successful! Please check your e-mail inbox to confirm. Join the mailing list for the latest news and offers from The York Norwich. Don’t miss out on seasonal events and exclusive deals. Accept Decline Manage Consent | Privacy Policy ✕ Manage Cookie Consent We use cookies to enhance your browsing experience and enable essential functions on our website. Some cookies are categorised as "Necessary" are automatically stored on your browser as they are crucial for the basic operation of the site - they can no be adjusted using these tools. Additionally, we use third-party cookies to help us analyse your usage of the website. These cookies are stored in your browser only with your prior consent. You have the option to enable or disable some or all of these cookies. Statistical Cookies Statistical or analytical cookies are used to gain insights into how visitors interact with the website. These cookies collect data on metrics like visitor count, bounce rate, traffic sources, and more, helping us understand and improve site performance. Advertising Cookies Advertisement cookies deliver personalised ads based on the pages you previously visited and help analyse the effectiveness of ad campaigns. About Us - The British Open Pub - The British Open Pub click here to ORDER NOW Menus Events About Us Gift Cards Contact Order Now Order Catering Menus Events About Us Gift Cards Contact Order Now Order Catering People are the heart and soul of any pub. Whether you curl up in our quaint English dining room or pony up to the neighborhood bar, you are sure to feel at home! We proudly serve everything from British favorites of fish & chips, cottage pie, and liver & onions to pub grub including juicy angus burgers and hot honey garlic wings. With over 300 whiskies, 20 draught beers, many fine wines & spirits, and specials, everyone is sure to find what they’ve been craving! The British Open Pub is the place to come for comfortable food, friends, and atmosphere! Pubs have always been the place to gather and chat. People are the heart and soul of any pub. The pub patron is not just a customer, but a guest and a friend. We strive to emulate the warmth and character of an English Village Pub, continuing and age-old British Tradition! History of The British Open Pub Originally opened in 1998, the British Open Pub has become a staple in the Venice Community!  Now led by mother/daughter team Kathy & Kelly Olliver, the British Open Pub remains committed to offering a consistent, quality product for a fair price.  The Pub is also privileged to be able to support many non-profits in the Venice Community. A Dog-Friendly Patio! Owners are allowed to accompany their well-behaved dogs on our Garden Patio!  Fill up with a fresh made peanut butter burger or skinny chicken off our Puppy Pub menu or cool off with our homemade doggie ice cream!  We love to pamper our Pub Pooches! The Whiskey Uprising With over 300 whiskies, there is always something new to enjoy at the British Open Pub.  The Whiskey Club meets on the 2nd Wednesday of each month to taste and learn about different whiskey selections.  Amateurs and Aficionados, alike, are encouraged to join in the fun! Hours Sun-Wed: 11AM to 10PM Thurs: 11AM to 11PM Fri & Sat: 11AM to 12AM Brunch Sun: 11AM to 2PM Happy Hour Daily: 11AM to 6PM. Location 367 Jacaranda Boulevard Venice, FL 34292 Contact us 941.492.9227 catering@britishopenpub.com Follow Follow Join Our Rewards Program Sign up for savings and rewards! Who we are - British Future Home About us Current funders Jobs Media Trustees Who we are What we do Projects and Themes Publications News Events Partner with us Contact s About us Who we are What we do Future programme Vision and values Current funders Trustees Media Jobs Partner Support us Projects & Themes Publications News Events Partner with us Contact About us - Who we are Sunder Katwala Director of British Future Sunder Katwala is the director of British Future. He has previously worked as a journalist. He was general secretary of the Fabian Society thinktank from 2003 to 2011, and was previously a leader writer and internet editor at the Observer, a research director of the Foreign Policy Centre and commissioning editor for politics and economics at the publisher Macmillan. He celebrated his 10th wedding anniversary with his wife, Stacy, in 2011, and is the proud father of four children, Zarina, Jay, Sonny and Indira. His support for Everton and Southend United football clubs reflects an upbringing in Cheshire and Essex, though he was born in Doncaster, Yorkshire, to parents who came to Britain from India and Ireland, to work for the NHS. Sunder is the author of 'How to be a patriot: Why love of country can end our very British culture war,' published by Harper North. Steve Ballinger Director of Communications Steve Ballinger is Director of Communications. Over the last 25 years he has worked in media and communications roles at Amnesty International UK, Shelter, VSO and the Advertising Standards Authority before joining British Future.  
Steve grew up in Leamington Spa in the West Midlands and went to university in Leeds. He describes himself as an enthusiastic but unsuccessful golfer, poker player and Nottingham Forest supporter, but a decent cook. He lives with his partner Sara in east London. Heather Rolfe Director of Research & Relationships Heather Rolfe is Director of Research and Relationships. She was previously Head of Research at Demos. Prior to that she led the social policy team at the National Institute of Economic and Social Research where her work focused on the economic and social impact of migration, including public attitudes. Heather was born in Bradford but grew up in Bristol and Hertfordshire. She went to university in Sheffield and Southampton, where she wrote her PhD on the experience of workplace automation. She lives in South London with her husband Simon, and close to her two grown up daughters. Heather loves London, especially its galleries, museums and restaurants. She loves it so much that she gets homesick on holiday. Heena Khaled Events and Engagement Manager Heena Khaled is the Events and Engagement Manager at British Future. She runs and develops British Future’s event programme. Jake Puddle Senior Researcher Jake Puddle is a Senior Researcher at British Future. He grew up in Canterbury before moving to London, where he completed a Master’s in Global Governance and Ethics at University College London. Jake’s work has involved co-delivering Talk Together, the UK’s biggest conversation about what divides us and what action is needed to create a more socially connected society. He has also authored multiple reports on the role of sport, history, volunteering and major events to build social connections between people from different backgrounds. Outside of work, Jake is a keen cook and can usually be found experimenting with curry recipes. Avaes Mohammad Associate Fellow Avaes Mohammad is a teacher at Eden Girls School Waltham Forest, a Muslim secondary school in East London. He has written publicly about race, identity and Muslim inclusion and integration. 
Avaes brings a range of experience to the team, from his current role in education to his background in the chemical sciences and practice as a professional playwright and poet. He was formerly a staff member at British Future, managing the 'Unknown and Untold' project which sought to raise public awareness during the First World War Centenary of the 400,000 Muslims from undivided India who served in the British Army in WW1 Jill Rutter Associate Fellow Jill Rutter’s Associate Fellowship is focused on integration and  cohesion. She was a co-author of British Future's After the Riots report and worked with British Future and Belong staff on research for the Commission on Community and Cohesion.
 
From 2016-2021 Jill was  Director of Strategy and Relationships at British Future. She  helped set up the Together Coalition and led Talk Together, the UK’s biggest conversation about what divides us and what brings us together in the wake of COVID-19. Jill also led the National Conversation on Immigration, which engaged more than 20,000 people. Jill has previously worked in academia, for the Refugee Council, the Institute for Public Policy Research, Learning and Work Intitute and for the funder Spirit of 2012.  She is the author of many books and articles on immigration, integration and community cohesion including Moving Up and Getting On (Policy Press, 2015). Patrick Vernon Associate Fellow Patrick Vernon has led the campaign for a national Windrush Day since 2010 and in 2018 kick-started the campaign for an amnesty for the Windrush Generation in response to the Windrush Scandal. He is a writer and broadcaster for national and international media on healthcare, cultural heritage and race, and co-authored ‘100 Great Black Britons’.
Patrick is Associate Director at the Centre for Ageing Better, Independent non-executive Director of Birmingham and Solihull Integrated Care System, Chair of the Citizenship Partnership for HSIB and non-executive Director for Hertfordshire NHS Trust. In August 2021 he was appointed Honorary Professor of cultural heritage and community leadership for the Department of Community Development at Wolverhampton University. Patrick was awarded an OBE in 2012 for his work on tackling health inequalities in ethnic minority communities. Kirren Rathor Media and Communications Officer Kirren brings to British Future 15 years’ experience as a Senior Journalist at BBC News, where she covered some of the world’s biggest stories including elections in the UK and overseas. She has covered race relations across the UK, including extremism and the investigation into the murder of Stephen Lawrence, and also has a specialist background in the cultural and political landscapes across South Asia. 
Outside of the BBC Kirren has also worked in specialist factual current affairs developing documentaries and podcasts. Saffron Powell PhD Placement Researcher Saffron Powell is a PhD Placement Researcher at British Future. She is a UKRI ESRC funded PhD candidate at King’s College London researching how teacher education providers across England prepare new teachers for an ethnically diverse society at a time where the teacher workforce in England remains predominately White British, yet our school children are the most ethnically diverse they have ever been. With a background in Biomedical Science and a master’s in teacher education from the University of Oxford, Saffron taught secondary school science for over 7 years, holding roles such as head of biology, KS3 science coordinator and newly qualified teacher (NQT - now ECT) mentor, before leaving the classroom to pursue her PhD. Also see Trustees Meet our trustees. Our experienced Board of Trustees ensures the good governance of British Future and offers valuable insight and experience to the staff team. Read More What we do British Future’s research into public attitudes on issues such as immigration, integration and identity helps us and our partners develop effective messages that reach and persuade new audiences. We offer constructive policy solutions to people’s legitimate concerns and work to find common ground that can bring people together. Read More Funders British Future is a registered charity. We are grateful to our funders – trusts and foundations, business voices and civic society organisations - and welcome discussions about future partnerships.
